criteria: Application of Knowledge to Real-World Scenarios
descriptions: Does not identify any household products or their potential harm.
Identifies at least one household product, but does not explain the harmful effect of ingestion or inhalation.
Identifies one or two household products and briefly mentions potential harm upon ingestion or inhalation.
Identifies several household products and provides a basic explanation of why they are harmful if ingested or inhaled.
Identifies multiple household products and explains in detail the specific harmful effects of ingestion and inhalation, linking it to the chemicals in the product.

Provides a comprehensive overview of various household products, detailing their chemical composition and explaining the specific health hazards associated with ingestion and inhalation, including long-term effects.
Does not explain any harmful effects.
Attempts to explain harmful effects, but provides inaccurate or irrelevant information.
Provides a vague or general explanation of potential harm, without specific details.
Explains some of the harmful effects of ingestion or inhalation, such as poisoning or irritation.
Explains the harmful effects, including chemical reactions within the body, damage to organs, and other health complications.

Presents a clear, detailed, and scientifically accurate explanation of the physiological and toxicological effects of the harmful substances when ingested or inhaled, showcasing a thorough understanding of the subject matter.
Does not apply knowledge to real-world scenarios.
Attempts to relate the information to real-world scenarios but fails to provide a clear connection.
Provides one basic example of a real-world scenario related to household product harm.
Describes a few real-world scenarios and relates them to the harmful effects of specific products.
Clearly connects the harmful properties of household products to potential real-world scenarios, such as accidental poisoning or improper use.

Analyzes and evaluates multiple real-world scenarios, offers preventive measures, and provides insightful recommendations for the safe handling and storage of household products to avoid potential harm.
